result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant Brandon T Aide in court.  Attorney Theresa L Lewandowski in court for State of Wisconsin. In court today for a hearing regarding pro se speedy trial demand in the 3 felony cases. DE is pro se, but does qualify for SPD. Court orders the State to provide a global resolution to the DE in writing in 2 weeks.
Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Hearing on November 1, 2022 at 11:45 am.

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant Brandon T Aide in court, in custody.  Attorney Colleen Lennon in court for State of Wisconsin. In court today for a bail/bond hearing as requested by the DE. State gives argument in opposition of DE request. DE gives statement. Court makes findings and denies the motion to modify bail/bond.
Bail/bond hearing on October 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with SMM. 
- Defendant shall not be in the 1000-1200 blocks of Morraine View Dr in Madison. 
- Defendant shall not be at any residence of SMM. 
- Defendant shall not be at any place of employment of SMM. 
- Defendant shall not be at Nextdoor Recover on Olin Dr in Madison. 
- Defendant shall not be within 500 feet of SMM.
- The Court finds substantial evidence that knowing and malicious prevention or dissuasion of the above victim(s) is reasonably likely to occur. The above conditions of release are hereby ordered pursuant to Sec. 940.47 and Chapter 969. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)].

Court reporter Tara Monthie. Defendant Brandon T Aide in court, in custody.  Attorney Shaun W O'Connell in court for Brandon T Aide.  Attorney Carl Lazarus in court for State of Wisconsin. In court today for a bail hearing in cases 22CF1842 and 22CF1855 as requested by the defense. Atty O'Connell gives argument. State objects to modification and gives argument. Court makes findings and will reduce cash bail as follows: in 22CF1842 cash bail is reduced to $500.00 and in 22CF1855 cash bail is reduced to $1,500. ALL OTHER BAIL CONDITIONS WILL REMAIN THE SAME IN BOTH CASES.
